reviews.text: While traveling in Santiago my wife and I decided that Hotel Orly would be the best choice for us based on price and location. I read many reviews and they all were complementary. The way we were treated was nothing more than awesome. From the time we set foot in the hotel until the time we left we were treated better than in any other hotel we've stayed. Even the higher price and more popular hotels we have stayed did not match to the personal care the staff of the Hotel Orly gave us.

reviews.text: The reason I decided to stay at the Hotel Orly was based on the reviews posted here. While the location was good (near many restaurants and shops as well as the metro), I would not return to that hotel in the future. The hotel itself is very quaint, with a very European feel to it and this I liked. However, I was given room # 13, which sits adjacent to the stairwell, where people descend as if they were cattle, particularly in the morning. Unless you like being awakened in this manner, and you do decide to stay at the Orly, BY ALL MEANS do NOT stay in room 13. The room itself is also very very tiny (to give you an idea, the bathroom door doesn't even open completely and I couldn't even put a mat on the floor to do Pilates. There simply wasn't enough space to lie horizontally on the floor without touching either the bed or the wall).

reviews.text: I am certainly not a hotel snob. I've stayed in very comfortable and quiet rooms for 20 bucks a night in Mexico City. I am currently in the Crystal Palace in Montevideo that runs 48$ a night, with free wireless and breakfast! But the Orly, for 77 dollars a night, a 200sq. foot room just isn't a good deal.

reviews.title: Nice Hotel in a Great Area

reviews.text: My mother (74) and myself stayed at the Orly Hotel for only one night. I would call it a small boutique type hotel. We found it delightful, quiet, quaint and with loads of character and very clean. We enjoyed our stay very much and would recommend it highly. The service was excellent and we found the breakfast yummy. The staff were able to hold our luggage whilst we looked around for the day and were most helpful when it came to organising a transfer back to the airport. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Delightful

reviews.text: My husband and I ( we are in our 50's) stayed at the Orly after being in Peru and Bolivia for 2 weeks. We had a weekend in Santiago and couldn't have asked for a nicer place. Our room was very homey, cozy and everything was spotless. It is a very quaint hotel with a lot of character. The people on the reception desk were always pleasant and very helpful. Breakfast was included ( which seems to be the norm for hotels in South America) and always started our day off on a good foot. There is a cafe at the front of the hotel which was a great place to sit and watch the world go by. The hotel is located in a very nice area, we took a lot of walks around the area and at no time did we ever feel unsafe. The subway is only a block or so away and it does not take long to get down town. If we were to return to Santiago, we would most definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: An oasis ...

reviews.text: We stayed in Santiago for a few nights in Jan of 2005 to wrap up our trip in Chile after having spent most of it in the Patagonia region. Hotel Orly was the perfect choice. It's in a nice part of the city, the receptionist is incredibly helpful, the rooms are comfortable and well thought out--snug but perfectly adequate. We highly recommend it to everyone!
reviews.title: Perfect

reviews.text: We stayed at the Orly for 2 nights in March 2006. We arrived a little early for check - in from a long and tiring flight from Sydney but our room was ready. This was small but very clean and quiet and everything you could want was there. The staff on the reception are excellent, speak very good English and are so helpful. There is coffee on the go at the back of reception 24 hours a day so if you have an early departure ( as we did) then you can at least have a drink before you go. The surrounding area was nice and we felt safe walking around even at night. We didn't know what to expect in Santiago but we really enjoyed our short stay and were more than happy with the Orly. We would have no hesitation recommending it to anyone.
reviews.title: A little gem
